title: Middle East Crisis: American Woman Shot and Killed at West Bank Protest
content: Aysenur Eygi, an Turkish American woman from Seattle, was demonstrating against Jewish settlements in the town of Beita on Friday when she was shot in the head.
summary: Aysenur Eygi, an Turkish American woman from Seattle, was demonstrating against Jewish settlements in the town of Beita on Friday when she was shot in the head.

title: Are Pacific Islands a ‘Dumping Ground’ for Accused Priests?
content: Over a decades-long period, more than 30 Catholic priests and missionaries moved to remote island nations after they had allegedly abused children in the West, or had been found to do so.
summary: Over a decades-long period, more than 30 Catholic priests and missionaries moved to remote island nations after they had allegedly abused children in the West, or had been found to do so.

title: Qatar’s Crucial Role in the Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Talks
content: The emirate has used its influence with Hamas to press for a truce with Israel. But “the last word is with those on the battlefield,” one expert said.
summary: The emirate has used its influence with Hamas to press for a truce with Israel. But “the last word is with those on the battlefield,” one expert said.

title: Distracted and Divided, Russian Security Service Misses Threats
content: The Ukrainian offensive over the border caught Moscow’s intelligence agencies by surprise, experts say. It wasn’t the first time that has happened during the war.
summary: The Ukrainian offensive over the border caught Moscow’s intelligence agencies by surprise, experts say. It wasn’t the first time that has happened during the war.

title: Eagles Players Feared Crime in Brazil. Is Philadelphia More Dangerous?

summary: Some N.F.L. players called Brazil dangerous ahead of the league’s first game in South America on Friday. Statistics show their home city is deadlier.

title: Fire at School Dormitory in Kenya Kills at Least 17 Students

title: China Stops Foreign Adoptions, Ending a Complicated Chapter
content: Beijing said the move was in line with international trends, as more countries have limited such adoptions. Many would-be adoptive families were left in limbo.
summary: Beijing said the move was in line with international trends, as more countries have limited such adoptions. Many would-be adoptive families were left in limbo.

title: Ukraine’s Zelensky Presses Western Allies for More Weapons
content: The Ukrainian leader argued that escalating military pressure on Russia, combined with diplomacy, was the best way to motivate Moscow to seek peace.
summary: The Ukrainian leader argued that escalating military pressure on Russia, combined with diplomacy, was the best way to motivate Moscow to seek peace.

title: Nurses Win a Bigger Role as Doctors Strike in South Korea
content: As hospitals struggle from a monthslong walkout, nurses have picked up some of the slack. A new law gives them more responsibilities and, they say, greater recognition.
summary: As hospitals struggle from a monthslong walkout, nurses have picked up some of the slack. A new law gives them more responsibilities and, they say, greater recognition.

title: Woman in France Testifies Against Husband Accused of Bringing Men to Rape Her
content: Gisèle Pelicot spoke of the horror of being told by the police that they had evidence her husband had drugged her for years and brought men into their home to join him in raping her.
summary: Gisèle Pelicot spoke of the horror of being told by the police that they had evidence her husband had drugged her for years and brought men into their home to join him in raping her.

title: Boko Haram Kills at Least 170 Villagers in Nigeria Attack
content: Boko Haram killed at least 170 villagers in northeastern Nigeria, community leaders say, in what is likely one of the deadliest attacks in recent years.
summary: Boko Haram killed at least 170 villagers in northeastern Nigeria, community leaders say, in what is likely one of the deadliest attacks in recent years.

title: German Police Shoot Gunman Dead Near Israeli Consulate in Munich

title: Dismissing Kursk, Putin Says Ukraine’s East Is Russia’s Main Goal

title: When Gambia Banned Female Genital Cutting, a Defiant 96-Year-Old Resisted
content: Yassin Fatty, a traditional practitioner of female genital cutting in the West African nation of Gambia, became the first to be convicted there. But her case led to a backlash and a popular campaign to make it legal again.
summary: Yassin Fatty, a traditional practitioner of female genital cutting in the West African nation of Gambia, became the first to be convicted there. But her case led to a backlash and a popular campaign to make it legal again.
